meanings.definition: Not able to be saved or improved.
meanings.sent1: The old, torn book was irredeemable and beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was irredeemable and had to be thrown away.
meanings.sent3: The irredeemable situation made everyone laugh at the hopelessness of it.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was irredeemable, like a ship lost at sea.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave was irredeemable, swallowing all light.

meanings.definition: Not able to be exchanged for money or goods.
meanings.sent1: The expired coupon was irredeemable and could not be used at the store.
meanings.sent2: The damaged gift card was irredeemable and had no value.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to trade the irredeemable item for a snack failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was irredeemable, like a counterfeit coin.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy was irredeemable, unable to be sold or fixed.

meanings.definition: Not able to be forgiven or absolved.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's actions were irredeemable, leading to a life sentence.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal was irredeemable, causing permanent damage to their friendship.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was so irredeemable that it became a running joke.
meanings.sent4: The stain on the carpet was irredeemable, a permanent reminder of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The mistake was irredeemable, haunting her like a ghost from the past.
